授業目的: Students will gain knowledge of the main elements of the psychology of language learning. Students will learn about the main psychological concepts (identity, motivation, self-efficacy, willingness to communicate, etc.) and the key people in the field.
到達目標: Students will gain an understanding of the main concepts of and researchers involved in the field of the psychology of language learning. Students will demonstrate their ability to explain and apply the concepts that are learned. Students will demonstrate their understanding of how to apply their knowledge of psychology to both language teaching and language learning.
授業方法: Discussion of the readings and the topics will take up about half of the class time. About a quarter of the class time will be spent on tasks and activities. During the remaining time, I will give short presentations on critical topics.

第1回:
Introduction and Overview of the Course
During the first session, I will provide a short introduction to the course, give a review of the syllabus and explain my course policies, including details about assignments and the final paper. Then, I will ask you about your background and interests that are related to psychology. Finally, if time permits, I will provide a short overview of educational psychology.
Read and prepare to discuss the handout for Session 02.
第2回:
Language and The Brain.
I will give a short explanation of our current understanding of the architecture and working of the brain. You will discuss the information in the reading. We will consider the language learning process and the link between the mental structures and aspects of human language. (Embedded Figures, Field Dependence / Independence)

Review class content.
Read and prepare to discuss the handout for next class.
第3回:
Memory and Measurement.
You will discuss the information from the reading and focus on how the content relates to previous topics in the course. I will give a short presentation on memory. We will try some memory experiments. I will point out some important aspects and cautions concerning psychological measurement. (Keyword Method)

Review class content.
Read and prepare to discuss the handout for next class.
第4回:
Identity [The Self; Self-Concept; Self-Identity].
You will discuss the information in the reading and focus on how the content relates to previous topics in the course. We will try to identify the key differences between the related concepts of self-concept, self-esteem, self-identity, and self-efficacy. We will discuss the connections between identity and how students participate in language courses.

Review class content.
Read and prepare to discuss the handout for next class.
第5回:
Personality and Preferences.
You will discuss the information in the reading and focus on how the content relates to previous topics in the course. I will make a short presentation about learning styles, attribution, affect, and feedback. We will discuss how and why teachers should give feedback to students. (Various Personality Indices)

Review class content.
Read and prepare to discuss the handout for next class.
第6回:
Motivation, Metacognition, and Goals.
You will discuss the information in the reading and focus on how the content relates to previous topics in the course. I will present an action/resource model of motivation. We will discuss how the different motivational models relate to the action/resource model. (Motivational Surveys)

Review class content.
Read and prepare to discuss the handout for next class.
第7回:
Motivation (Continued) and Review
You will discuss the information in the reading and focus on how the content relates to previous topics in the course. We will consider various teaching scenarios and discuss practical techniques for dealing with student motivational issues. Then we will review some of the previous topics. (Motivation and Action)

Review class content.
Read and prepare to discuss the handout for next class.
第8回:
Short Student Presentations.
You will take turns making short presentations concerning your individual topic of interest. We will discuss the content of the presentations.
Prepare a 7-10 minute presentation about your individual topic of interest.
第9回:
The Learner and Learner Development.
You will discuss the content of the reading and focus on how the content relates to previous topics in the course. I will give a short presentation on constructivism. (Environment, Group Dynamics, Constructivism, Communities of Practice)

Review class content.
Read and prepare to discuss the handout for next class.
第10回:
The Learning Environment.
You will discuss the content of the reading and focus on how the content relates to previous topics in the course. I will make a presentation concerning the different social groups involved in the formal learning process.

Review class content.
Read and prepare to discuss the handout for next class.
第11回:
Implicit Theories & Beliefs.
You will discuss the content of the reading and focus on how the content relates to previous topics in the course. I will make a presentation concerning the types of beliefs that are involved. Then we will consider how those beliefs may differ between the various parties involved (learners, teachers, administrators, parents).

Review class content.
Read and prepare to discuss the handout for next class.
第12回:
Styles & Strategies.
You will discuss the content of the reading and focus on how the content relates to previous topics in the course. I will make a short presentation on strategies. Finally, we will look at one tool for assessing strategy use and discuss its application.

Review class content.
Read and prepare to discuss the handout for next class.
第13回:
Methodologies & Materials.
I will make a presentation of some different language teaching methodologies and we will discuss their psychological aspects. I will explain about two main theories of task complexity from a psychological aspect. Then, students will discuss the psychological aspects of selected teaching materials.

Review class content.
Read and prepare to discuss the handout for next class.
第14回:
Short Student Presentations & Evaluation.
You will take turns making short presentations concerning your individual topic of interest. We will discuss the content of the presentations. You will complete the course evaluation survey.
Prepare a 7-10 minute presentation about your individual topic of interest.
トピック.授業外学習2: Each week you will need to read and prepare to discuss at least one handout or article in English about the following week's topic. The discussion will focus on the content of the reading your reaction to the reading, implications on the content regarding language teaching and learning, and how the content fits in with previous readings.
